title: Retro Unique Display Font
author: splrful

comments.content: What are the closest resembling fonts that are (preferably) free?

Here are a couple.  
Manicuore

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ManicuoreAsArsenic_5543.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/manicuore/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/manicuore/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/manicuore/")  
Smashing  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SmashingAsArsenic_5991.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/smashing/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/smashing/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/smashing/")  
Don

Also  
Fido

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FidoAsArsenic_4507.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/fido/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/fido/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/fido/")  
Comrade 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ComradeAsArsenic_3652.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/comrade/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/comrade/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/comrade/")  
FT Giorgio Bold  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FTGiorgioBoldAsArsenic_4868.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/ft-giorgio/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/ft-giorgio/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/ft-giorgio/")  
Poster Cut free font  
 [http://www.ladd-design.com/ladd--poster-cut-font---free.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/www.ladd-design.com/ladd--poster-cut-font---free.html "http://www.ladd-design.com/ladd--poster-cut-font---free.html")  
Gorg free font  
 [http://fontazilla.com/gorg.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/fontazilla.com/gorg.html "http://fontazilla.com/gorg.html")  
Don

Funny because I really thought it was no font and while starting the search trying to complete excellent list compiled by Don, I've encountered with the match. And you know what? It's free and called ' [Eastwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/www.dafont.com/eastwood.font)'. Lucky day :)

Good find Ryuk.  
Eastwood seems to have been derived from the 1960s poster for \_A FISTFULL OF DOLLARS\_ [http://i158.photobucket.com/albums/t84/theclinteastwoodarchive/HiQuality...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/i158.photobucket.com/albums/t84/theclinteastwoodarchive/HiQualityUKQuad.png "http://i158.photobucket.com/albums/t84/theclinteastwoodarchive/HiQualityUKQuad.png")  
The ARSENIC AND OLD LACE image seems to be relatively recent and clearly uses Eastwood.  
A reminder that when looking at an image for font ID its really helpful to know the approximate date.  
Don

Daniel Gauthier informs of his source for Eastwood by means of the image

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Eastwood_6186.gif)
 on his website [http://moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/gaut/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053919/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/gaut/ "http://moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/gaut/")  
Don
